questions.question: Which of the following substances can be used to remove rust?
questions.feedback: Rust is hydrated iron(III) oxide and can react with acid.

questions.question:
&6Y Sulphate &ris mixed with &bNaOH(aq)&r, a &lWhite Precipitate &ris formed,
which &bdissolves &rin excess &bNaOH solution&r.
Y is probably?
questions.feedback: Only Zn(OH)2 & Pb(OH)2 can redissolve in excess NaOH solution, however, sulphate of Y is soluble in water. Thus Y is Zinc.

questions.question: Which of the following ammonium compounds should NOT be used in preparation of ammonia?
questions.feedback: If you heat ammonium nitrate, you will become Taliban.

questions.question: Which of the following acid shows the lowest electrical conductivity?
questions.feedback: Among the 4 acids, only ethanoic acid is a weak acid which ionizes slightly in water.

questions.question:
In which of the following ionic compounds do 
both the cation and anion have the same number of electrons?
